dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Zacks Market Edge Highlights: Red Cat, Barrick Gold, Arista Networks, Nio and Apple
News Content: For Immediate Release

Chicago, IL – January 27, 2025 – Zacks Market Edge is a podcast hosted weekly by Zacks Stock Strategist Tracey Ryniec. Every week, Tracey will be joined by guests to discuss the hottest investing topics in stocks, bonds and ETFs and how it impacts your life. To listen to the podcast, click here:  https://www.zacks.com/stock/news/2403156/questions-and-answers-on-your-5-favorite-stocks

Questions and Answers on Your 5 Favorite Stocks

Welcome to Episode #431 of the Zacks Market Edge Podcast.

(0:30) - Breaking Down The Stock Picks Investors Want To Know About (3:55) - Top Picks To Keep On Your Watchlist Right Now (31:40) - Episode Roundup: RCAT, GOLD, ANET, NIO, AAPL Podcast@Zacks.com

Every week, host and Zacks stock strategist, Tracey Ryniec, will be joined by guests to discuss the hottest investing topics in stocks, bonds, and ETFs and how it impacts your life.

This week, Tracey is going solo to answer some of the questions left for her in the YouTube comments to prior podcasts. These were questions mostly about individual stock. She aims to please on talking about some of your favorite stocks.

This week's list includes stocks from various industries and it even includes some small caps as well as one Magnificent 7 stock.

Tracey looked at the Price, Consensus and Earnings Surprise chart for each, as well as the earnings estimate data.

A Look at 5 of Your Favorite Stocks

1. Red Cat Holdings, Inc. RCAT

Red Cat Holdings is a small cap company with a market cap of $701 million which makes drone technology for military, government, and commercial operations.

Shares of Red Cat Holdings are down 41% year-to-date, but the shares have soared 1003% over the last year. It's a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell) but Zacks only has one earnings estimate.

Should you take a chance on Red Cat Holdings?

2. Barrick Gold Corp. GOLD

Barrick Gold is a large cap global gold miner. Tracey talked about the gold trade, specifically with the miners, in a 2024 podcast because the price of gold was hitting new highs.

Shares of Barrick Gold are up 2.3% year-to-date but have only gained 1.5% over the last year. It's cheap, with a forward price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 9.7. 2025 earnings are expected to rise 30.3%.

Barrick Gold is a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) stock.

Should a gold miner, like Barrick Gold, be on your short list?

3. Arista Networks Inc. ANET

Arista Networks is a leader in data-driven, cloud-to-client networking for large AI, data center, campus, and routing environments. It has a market cap of $163 billion.

Shares of Arista Networks have soared over the last year, rising 93.7%. In 2025, they're up another 15.9% to new all-time highs. Arista Networks isn't cheap. It trades with a forward P/E of 53.6. Sales and earnings are expected to rise by the double digits again in 2025.

Story Continues

Arista Networks is a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) stock. It reports earnings on Feb 18, 2025.

Should an AI play like Arista Networks be on your watch list?

4. Nio Inc. NIO

Nio is a Chinese global smart vehicle manufacturer. It has a market cap of $7.3 billion.

Shares of Nio are down 5.7% year-to-date and have fallen 30.9% over the last year. Nio doesn't have a P/E ratio because it's earnings are still negative. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for 2025 is calling for a loss of $1.01.

Nio is a Zacks #3 (Hold) stock.

With shares trading near 5-year lows, should a smart car manufacturer like Nio be on your watch list?

5. Apple Inc. AAPL

Apple is a Magnificent 7 stock and is one of the four pillars of Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway empire. But shares of Apple have declined 11.3% year-to-date and are now "only" up 15.4% over the last year.

But even though the shares have weakened, Apple is not cheap. It still trades with a forward P/E ratio of 30.1. A P/E ratio under 15 is considered a value.

Apple also has a Zacks Rank of a 4, or Sell.

If Apple falls further, would it be a buying opportunity?

What Else Do You Need to Know About These 5 Favorite Stocks?

Tune into this week's podcast to find out.

Why Haven't You Looked at Zacks' Top Stocks?

Since 2000, our top stock-picking strategies have blown away the S&P's +7.0 average gain per year. Amazingly, they soared with average gains of +44.9%, +48.4% and +55.2% per year.

Today you can access their live picks without cost or obligation.

See Stocks Free >>

Follow us on Twitter:  https://twitter.com/zacksresearch

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/ZacksInvestmentResearch/

Zacks Investment Research is under common control with affiliated entities (including a broker-dealer and an investment adviser), which may engage in transactions involving the foregoing securities for the clients of such affiliates.

Media Contact

Zacks Investment Research

800-767-3771 ext. 9339

support@zacks.com

https://www.zacks.com/performance

Past performance is no guarantee of future results. Inherent in any investment is the potential for loss. This material is being provided for informational purposes only and nothing herein constitutes investment, legal, accounting or tax advice, or a recommendation to buy, sell or hold a security. No recommendation or advice is being given as to whether any investment is suitable for a particular investor. It should not be assumed that any investments in securities, companies, sectors or markets identified and described were or will be profitable. All information is current as of the date of herein and is subject to change without notice. Any views or opinions expressed may not reflect those of the firm as a whole. Zacks Investment Research does not engage in investment banking, market making or asset management activities of any securities. These returns are from hypothetical portfolios consisting of stocks with Zacks Rank = 1 that were rebalanced monthly with zero transaction costs. These are not the returns of actual portfolios of stocks. The S&P 500 is an unmanaged index. Visit https://www.zacks.com/performancefor information about the performance numbers displayed in this press release.

Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today, you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days. Click to get this free report

Zacks Investment Research

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.25, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.75, Reasoning: The news highlights that Apple Inc. (AAPL) is currently experiencing a decline of 11.3% year-to-date and has a Zacks Rank of 4 (Sell), indicating bearish sentiment. Despite being a part of the 'Magnificent 7' and having a strong market presence, the high forward P/E ratio of 30.1 suggests that the stock may be overvalued. The overall market sentiment and the company's current performance metrics lead to a higher probability of further decline in stock price rather than recovery in the short term.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article from Zacks Market Edge mentions Apple (AAPL) as one of the five stocks discussed in their podcast. While the article itself doesn't contain overwhelmingly positive or negative information, it highlights that Apple's stock is down 11.3% year-to-date, trades at a high forward P/E ratio of 30.1, and has a Zacks Rank of 4 (Sell). This suggests a bearish outlook. The article poses the question of whether further declines would present a buying opportunity, implying potential for further price drops. The overall tone is neutral to slightly negative, suggesting a higher probability of a price fall in the short term. However, the mention of Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway's holding in Apple provides some support, preventing a completely bearish outlook.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The Zacks Market Edge podcast mentions Apple (AAPL) as one of five stocks discussed, alongside companies from diverse sectors.  While the podcast notes Apple's recent decline (11.3% year-to-date) and a Zacks Rank of 4 (Sell),  it doesn't offer any specific new information or analysis that would significantly impact Apple's stock price. The mention itself is brief and part of a broader discussion.  The 'Sell' rating is a factor suggesting potential downward pressure, but it's not a new development and is already reflected in the current market price.  Therefore, the probability of a price movement significantly influenced by this news alone is low.  The probabilities are weighted more towards the existing market trends and overall economic factors rather than this specific podcast mention.

(AAPL) in the context of a podcast that analyzes various stocks. Apple is mentioned as a Magnificent 7 stock and part of Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway empire. However, it is noted that Apple's shares have declined 11.3% year-to-date and are up only 15.4% over the last year. The article highlights that Apple is not cheap, trading with a forward P/E ratio of 30.1, and has a Zacks Rank of 4 (Sell). The tone of the article suggests caution regarding Apple's stock, indicating potential downside risk.

The overall tone is neutral to slightly negative, but it does not provide a clear catalyst for a significant stock price increase.

While it mentions Apple's recent decline (11.3% year-to-date), high P/E ratio (30.1), and Zacks Rank 4 (Sell), it doesn't offer any new, impactful information. The podcast's question about whether further decline would create a buying opportunity suggests uncertainty, not a definitive prediction.  The previous predictions range from 0.25 to 0.45 probability of a price rise, and 0.55 to 0.75 probability of a price fall.  Considering the lack of significant new information in this news and the existing bearish sentiment reflected in the Zacks Rank and P/E ratio, I'm leaning towards a slightly higher probability of a price fall. However, the range of previous predictions suggests considerable uncertainty, and the news itself is not a strong catalyst for either a significant rise or fall.

Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
    "reasoning": "The financial news and previous predictions consistently highlight a bearish sentiment for Apple Inc. (AAPL). Key factors such as a year-to-date decline of 11.3%, a high forward P/E ratio of 30.1, and a Zacks Rank of 4 (Sell) contribute to a cautious outlook. Although Apple is a Magnificent 7 stock and backed by Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway, these points of support are outweighed by the negative indicators. The neutral to slightly negative tone of the news and the lack of new positive catalysts reinforce the expectation of further price decline.",
    "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
    "company_symbol": "AAPL",
    "news_headline": "Zacks Market Edge Highlights: Red Cat, Barrick Gold, Arista Networks, Nio and Apple",
    "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.25,
    "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.75
}
```
